db:abstract.db:para: Instructions How to Use Enterprise Qt Debian Packages.

db:article.db:para: To use Enterprise Debian packages with Qt, add your enterprise repositories to Advanced Packaging Tool (APT). For details, see Debian Repository Configuration Format.
To use the enterprise repositories, you need to:

db:listitem.db:para: Install a public GPG key for enterprise repositories
Configure Qt Account based authentication for enterprise repository access

db:note.db:para: The Enterprise Qt Debian packages are provided as technology-preview packages. For more details and support, contact us.

db:section.db:title: Debian Repository Configuration Format
db:section.db:para: To add extra repositories for APT, insert repositories into a file with an extension of .list under the /etc/apt/sources.list.d directory. For each repository, add a new entry in the file. The generic format is as follows:
An example of an enterprise repository entry:
See Repository information for Qt Releases for detailed information on how you can configure repositories per Qt release and architecture.

db:section.db:title: Installing Public GPG Key
db:section.db:para: Install a public GPG (GNU Privacy Guard) key for Enterprise Qt Debian repositories as follows:
db:section.db:programlisting: $ mkdir -p $HOME/keyrings/tqtc # pick a suitable location for you! $ cd $HOME/keyrings/tqtc $ wget https://cdn.qt.io/debian/keys/qt-company-debian-repo.gpg

db:section.db:title: Configuring Authentication
db:section.db:para: To access the listed repositories, you need an enterprise Qt Account or an evaluation Qt Account.

db:note.db:para: If your password contains special characters, you may need to escape those by using '\' or '%40'.

db:section.db:para: Configure the Qt Account credentials for your APT package manager as follows:

db:section.db:title: Updating Local Package Cache
db:section.db:para: Update the local package cache as follows:
No errors should originate from the added repository in the output.

db:section.db:title: Full Configuration Example
db:section.db:para: The following code snippet demonstrates the whole work flow with Enterprise Qt Debian packages:
db:section.db:programlisting:
# install repository key $ mkdir -p $HOME/keyrings/tqtc $ cd $HOME/keyrings/tqtc $ wget https://cdn.qt.io/debian/keys/qt-company-debian-repo.gpg
# configure Qt Account based authentication to Qt Debian repositories $ sudo nano /etc/apt/auth.conf machine https://debian-packages.qt.io login <your Qt Account email> password <your Qt Account password>
# add repositories $ sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list.d/tqtc.list deb [arch=arm64 signed-by=/home/<user>/keyrings/tqtc/qt-company-debian-repo.gpg] https://debian-packages.qt.io/debian/enterprise/qt-6.3.1-arm64 tqtc-focal main
# update local package cache $ sudo apt-get update
# search and install packages $ apt-cache search qt6.3.1 .... .... # files are installed under /opt/qt-6.3.1/ $ sudo apt-get install qt6.3.1-declarative-dev qt6.3.1-declarative-private-dev ...
db:section.db:para: See Repository information for Qt Releases to pick the needed repositories into your /etc/apt/sources.list.d/tqtc.list file.

db:section.db:title: Difficulties in authentication
db:section.db:para: The server may response with the following HTTP error codes:

db:section.db:title: 401 Unauthorized
db:section.db:para: Wrong credentials. User email and password must be provided in correct format.
Also, try storing the credentials directly into the repository config:
If your password contains special characters, you may need to escape those for APT. Use '' or '%40' for escaping those characters or try changing your Qt Account password.

db:section.db:title: 403 Forbidden
db:section.db:para: Missing credentials.

db:section.db:title: 429 Too Many Requests
db:section.db:para: User has sent too much failed requests (3 requests per minute).

db:section.db:title: 500 Internal Server Error
db:section.db:para: Contact Qt support.

db:section.db:title: Difficulties with repository GPG key usage
db:section.db:para: An alternative to 'signed-by' usage attribute in the repository config is to install the key in the following way, althoug this is not recommended as it's deprecated way to install it:

db:section.db:title: Repository information for Qt Releases
db:section.db:para: Below you can find the Qt releases that the Enterprise Qt Debian packages supports. Pick the needed repositories and add them to your /etc/apt/sources.list.d/tqtc.list as instructed above.
Also, the following tables list the installation directories on your system and the Linux distribution compatible with the packages.

db:note.db:para: To access the listed repositories, you need an evaluation Qt Account or a commercial Qt Account with a Qt for Device Creation license.
The packages may work on other distributions as well but there is no guarantee on that.
